title: Drawing, "Valley of El Arabah, Palestine", February 21, 1868
medium: Graphite, white gouache on gray wove paper
inscribed:
Bottom left:  "Valley of El Arabah"/ Feb. 21st 68 corrected from "20st" to "21st"
Center:  "2 Mt Hor / 3 Dry sandy bed white / 4 gold sandy color / 5 Golden Brown / 6 Richer redder Brown / 7 Plain greyer and whiter /  Mountains lovely blue over shadowed by / a word struck out / clouds and streaked with shadows / Cloud shadows on plain dark purple.  Snow thin on mountains occasional / brilliant gleam.  Light on mountains like opalescent fire". 

Inscribed in graphite at lower left:  Valley of El Arabah / Feb. 21st 68; various color notations at lower center.
description: The plain is shown in the distance against a background of mountains with Mount Hôr at the extreme right.  A valley leads backwards to the plain, in the fore and middle grounds.  A river bed winds through it, a road along the hillside at right.  Dromedaries and men are shown upon it.  Inscribed figures.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Valley of El Arabah, Palestine", February 21, 1868.
February 21, 1868. Graphite, white gouache on gray wove paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-583.
